abort.addon_get_discovery_info_failed: Failed to get Z-Wave add-on discovery info.
abort.addon_info_failed: Failed to get Z-Wave add-on info.
abort.addon_install_failed: Failed to install the Z-Wave add-on.
abort.addon_required: The Z-Wave migration flow requires the integration to be configured using the Z-Wave Supervisor add-on. You can still use the Backup and Restore buttons to migrate your network manually.
abort.addon_start_failed: Failed to start the Z-Wave add-on.
abort.addon_stop_failed: Failed to stop the Z-Wave add-on.
abort.config_entry_not_loaded: The Z-Wave configuration entry is not loaded. Please try again when the configuration entry is loaded.
abort.different_device: The connected USB device is not the same as previously configured for this config entry. Please instead create a new config entry for the new device.
abort.migration_low_sdk_version:
The SDK version of the old controller is lower than {ok_sdk_version}. This means it's not possible to migrate the Non Volatile Memory (NVM) of the old controller to another controller.

Check the documentation on the manufacturer support pages of the old controller, if it's possible to upgrade the firmware of the old controller to a version that is build with SDK version {ok_sdk_version} or higher.
abort.not_zwave_device: Discovered device is not a Z-Wave device.
abort.not_zwave_js_addon: Discovered add-on is not the official Z-Wave add-on.

error.addon_start_failed: Failed to start the Z-Wave add-on. Check the configuration.

progress.install_addon: Please wait while the Z-Wave add-on installation finishes. This can take several minutes.
progress.start_addon: Please wait while the Z-Wave add-on start completes. This may take some seconds.
progress.backup_nvm: Please wait while the network backup completes.
progress.restore_nvm: Please wait while the network restore completes.

data.lr_s2_access_control_key: Long Range S2 Access Control Key

configure_addon_user.description: The add-on will generate security keys if those fields are left empty.
configure_addon_user.title: Enter the Z-Wave add-on configuration

hassio_confirm.description: Do you want to set up the Z-Wave integration with the Z-Wave add-on?

install_addon.title: The Z-Wave add-on installation has started

on_supervisor.description: Do you want to use the Z-Wave Supervisor add-on?
on_supervisor.title: Select connection method

usb_confirm.description: Do you want to set up {name} with the Z-Wave add-on?

zeroconf_confirm.description: Do you want to add the Z-Wave Server with home ID {home_id} found at {url} to Home Assistant?
zeroconf_confirm.title: Discovered Z-Wave Server

reconfigure.title: Migrate or re-configure
reconfigure.description: Are you migrating to a new controller or re-configuring the current controller?

intent_migrate.title: [%key:component::zwave_js::config::step::reconfigure::menu_options::intent_migrate%]
intent_migrate.description:
Before setting up your new controller, your old controller needs to be reset. A backup will be performed first.

Do you wish to continue?

instruct_unplug.title: Unplug your old controller
instruct_unplug.description:
Backup saved to "{file_path}"

Your old controller has been reset. If the hardware is no longer needed, you can now unplug it.

Please make sure your new controller is plugged in before continuing.

restore_failed.title: Restoring unsuccessful
restore_failed.description:
Your Z-Wave network could not be restored to the new controller. This means that your Z-Wave devices are not connected to Home Assistant.

The backup is saved to ”{file_path}”

action_type.set_value: Set value of a Z-Wave Value

condition_type.value: Current value of a Z-Wave Value

trigger_type.zwave_js.value_updated.value: Value change on a Z-Wave Value

abort.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to {device_name}. Please try again later after confirming that your Z-Wave network is up and connected to Home Assistant.
abort.issue_ignored: Device config file update for {device_name} ignored.

init.description:
The device configuration file for {device_name} has changed.

Z-Wave discovers a lot of device metadata by interviewing the device. However, some of the information has to be loaded from a configuration file. Some of this information is only evaluated once, during the device interview.

When a device config file is updated, this information may be stale and and the device must be re-interviewed to pick up the changes.

 This is not a required operation and device functionality will be impacted during the re-interview process, but you may see improvements for your device once it is complete.

If you decide to proceed with the re-interview, it will take place in the background.
init.title: Device configuration file changed: {device_name}

invalid_server_version.description: The version of Z-Wave Server you are currently running is too old for this version of Home Assistant. Please update the Z-Wave Server to the latest version to fix this issue.
invalid_server_version.title: Newer version of Z-Wave Server needed

confirm.description:
A Z-Wave controller of model {controller_model} with a different id ({new_unique_id}) than the previously connected controller ({old_unique_id}) was connected to the {config_entry_title} configuration entry.

Reasons for a different controller id could be:

1. The controller was factory reset, with a 3rd party application.
2. A controller Non Volatile Memory (NVM) backup was restored to the controller, with a 3rd party application.
3. A different controller was connected to this configuration entry.

If a different controller was connected, you should instead set up a new configuration entry for the new controller.

If you are sure that the current controller is the correct controller you can confirm this by pressing Submit and the configuration entry will remember the new controller id.
confirm.title: An unknown controller was detected

bulk_set_partial_config_parameters.description: Allows for bulk setting partial parameters. Useful when multiple partial parameters have to be set at the same time.

value.description: The new value(s) to set for this configuration parameter. Can either be a raw integer value to represent the bulk change or a mapping where the key is the bitmask (either in hex or integer form) and the value is the new value you want to set for that partial parameter.
value.name: [%key:component::zwave_js::services::set_config_parameter::fields::value::name%]

bulk_set_partial_config_parameters.name: Bulk set partial configuration parameters (advanced)

clear_lock_usercode.description: Clears a user code from a lock.

code_slot.description: Code slot to clear code from.
code_slot.name: Code slot

clear_lock_usercode.name: Clear lock user code

invoke_cc_api.description: Calls a Command Class API on a node. Some Command Classes can't be fully controlled via the `set_value` action and require direct calls to the Command Class API.

area_id.description: The area(s) to target for this action. If an area is specified, all Z-Wave devices and entities in that area will be targeted for this action.
area_id.name: Area ID(s)

command_class.description: The ID of the command class that you want to issue a command to.
command_class.name: [%key:component::zwave_js::services::set_value::fields::command_class::name%]

device_id.description: The device(s) to target for this action.
device_id.name: Device ID(s)

endpoint.description: The endpoint to call the API on. If an endpoint is specified, that endpoint will be targeted for all nodes associated with the target areas, devices, and/or entities. If an endpoint is not specified, the root endpoint (0) will be targeted for nodes associated with target areas and devices, and the endpoint for the primary value of each entity will be targeted.
endpoint.name: [%key:component::zwave_js::services::set_config_parameter::fields::endpoint::name%]

entity_id.description: The entity ID(s) to target for this action.
entity_id.name: Entity ID(s)

method_name.description: The name of the API method to call. Refer to the Z-Wave Command Class API documentation (https://zwave-js.github.io/node-zwave-js/#/api/CCs/index) for available methods.
method_name.name: Method name

parameters.description: A list of parameters to pass to the API method. Refer to the Z-Wave Command Class API documentation (https://zwave-js.github.io/node-zwave-js/#/api/CCs/index) for parameters.
parameters.name: Parameters

invoke_cc_api.name: Invoke a Command Class API on a node (advanced)

multicast_set_value.description: Changes any value that Z-Wave recognizes on multiple Z-Wave devices using multicast, so all devices receive the message simultaneously. This action has minimal validation so only use this action if you know what you are doing.

broadcast.description: Whether the command should be broadcast to all devices on the network.
broadcast.name: Broadcast

multicast_set_value.name: Set a value on multiple devices via multicast (advanced)

ping.description: Forces Z-Wave to try to reach a node. This can be used to update the status of the node in Z-Wave when you think it doesn't accurately reflect reality, e.g. reviving a failed/dead node or marking the node as asleep.
ping.name: Ping a node

refresh_notifications.description: Refreshes notifications on a node based on notification type and optionally notification event.

notification_event.description: The Notification Event number as defined in the Z-Wave specs.
notification_event.name: Notification Event

notification_type.description: The Notification Type number as defined in the Z-Wave specs.
notification_type.name: Notification Type

refresh_notifications.name: Refresh notifications on a node (advanced)

refresh_value.description: Force updates the values of a Z-Wave entity.

refresh_all_values.description: Whether to refresh all values or just the primary value.
refresh_all_values.name: Refresh all values

refresh_value.name: Refresh values

reset_meter.description: Resets the meters on a node.

meter_type.description: The type of meter to reset. Not all meters support the ability to pick a meter type to reset.
meter_type.name: Meter type

value.description: The value that meters should be reset to. Not all meters support the ability to be reset to a specific value.
value.name: Target value

reset_meter.name: Reset meters on a node

set_config_parameter.description: Changes the configuration parameters of your Z-Wave devices.

bitmask.description: Target a specific bitmask (see the documentation for more information). Cannot be combined with 'Value size' or 'Value format'.
bitmask.name: Bitmask

parameter.description: The name (or ID) of the configuration parameter you want to configure.
parameter.name: Parameter

value.description: The new value to set for this configuration parameter.
value.name: Value

value_format.description: Format of the value, 0 for signed integer, 1 for unsigned integer, 2 for enumerated, 3 for bitfield. Used in combination with 'Value size' when a config parameter is not defined in your device's configuration file. Cannot be combined with 'Bitmask'.
value_format.name: Value format

value_size.description: Size of the value, either 1, 2, or 4. Used in combination with 'Value format' when a config parameter is not defined in your device's configuration file. Cannot be combined with 'Bitmask'.
value_size.name: Value size

set_config_parameter.name: Set device configuration parameter

set_lock_configuration.description: Sets the configuration for a lock.

auto_relock_time.description: Duration in seconds until lock returns to secure state. Only enforced when operation type is `constant`.
auto_relock_time.name: Auto relock time

block_to_block.description: Whether the lock should run the motor until it hits resistance.
block_to_block.name: Block to Block

hold_and_release_time.description: Duration in seconds the latch stays retracted.
hold_and_release_time.name: Hold and release time

lock_timeout.description: Seconds until lock mode times out. Should only be used if operation type is `timed`.
lock_timeout.name: Lock timeout

operation_type.description: The operation type of the lock.
operation_type.name: Operation type

twist_assist.description: Whether the motor should help in locking and unlocking.
twist_assist.name: Twist Assist

set_lock_configuration.name: Set lock configuration

set_lock_usercode.description: Sets a user code on a lock.

code_slot.description: Code slot to set the code.
code_slot.name: [%key:component::zwave_js::services::clear_lock_usercode::fields::code_slot::name%]

set_lock_usercode.name: Set lock user code

set_value.description: Changes any value that Z-Wave recognizes on a Z-Wave device. This action has minimal validation so only use this action if you know what you are doing.

area_id.description: The area(s) to target for this action. If an area is specified, all Z-Wave devices and entities in that area will be targeted for this action.
area_id.name: Area ID(s)

command_class.description: The ID of the command class for the value.
command_class.name: Command class

device_id.description: The device(s) to target for this action.
device_id.name: Device ID(s)

entity_id.description: The entity ID(s) to target for this action.
entity_id.name: Entity ID(s)

options.description: Set value options map. Refer to the Z-Wave documentation for more information on what options can be set.
options.name: Options

property.description: The ID of the property for the value.
property.name: Property

property_key.description: The ID of the property key for the value.
property_key.name: Property key

wait_for_result.description: Whether to wait for a response from the node. If not included in the payload, the integration will decide whether to wait or not. If enabled, the action can take a while if setting a value on an asleep battery device.
wait_for_result.name: Wait for result

set_value.name: Set a value (advanced)
